title: Blood Contract

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: Welcome back. What's going on with Daein?

intro.speaker: Janaff
intro.line: They're hold up in this big castle to the east. I'd say ten thousand soldiers, give or take. They're looking pretty desperate.

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: To the east, eh? It's just like Soren said. Nox is the next battlefield.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Ten thousand? They aren't really going to try to fight us with only ten thousand men, are they? It'd be suicide!

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: Daein should know about the rebellion in the empire by now. We should speak with them. They have nothing to gain by siding with the senate. Why continue the fighting?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: We can't afford to lose any more troops or time here, either. We should be at the senate's doorstep by now.

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: Agreed. Sephiran has earned some time for us. We can't afford to lose that advantage. We must press on. Let us win this battle quickly and continue on our way!

intro.speaker: Rafiel
intro.line: General Ike. Please allow us to join you on the battlefield.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Shouldn't you be watching over the medallion with your brother and sister? Is it really a good idea for you to be away?

intro.speaker: Rafiel
intro.line: They can manage without me for a while. I am here because I must see Micaiah. I want to save her. I can reason with her. I know it.

intro.speaker: Nailah
intro.line: If we can talk to her face-to-face, maybe she will understand. It's also for our own peace of mind.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: All right. Come with us. I'll tell my men to avoid firing at Micaiah. Sound good?

intro.speaker: Rafiel
intro.line: Thank you, Ike.

intro.speaker: Daein
intro.line: The outer gate has been breached! The apostle's army is storming the castle!

intro.speaker: Sothe
intro.line: Here they come.

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: ...It all ends here.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Let's finish this fight quickly! All units, attack!

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: We will not lose! We cannot lose! If we lose today, everything Pelleas has done will have been in vain! In the name of King Pelleas, fight for Daein!

intro.speaker: Daein
intro.line: Maiden, please take this. You are the commander general of the Daein army. It is imperative that you lead our troops from this spot. However, with this tome, you can aid your allies from afar.

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: Thank you.

dialogue.speaker: Micaiah
dialogue.line: You can't be serious, Your Majesty!

dialogue.speaker: Pelleas
dialogue.line: But, I am. Don't you see?! This is the way to save Daein! The information was in a book hidden away in a secret room. I think it is reliable.

dialogue.speaker: Tauroneo
dialogue.line: I must ask you to reconsider, my king. There has to be another way. There must be!

dialogue.speaker: Pelleas
dialogue.line: We can't afford to wait for another solution to present itself. We have to try.

dialogue.speaker: Micaiah
dialogue.line: ...I cannot go through with it.

dialogue.speaker: Pelleas
dialogue.line: Micaiah, the life of every single person in Daein depends on this! If it works, we can stop fighting this absurd war. It will be all right. I know this will work! Please do this for me, Micaiah.

dialogue.speaker: Micaiah
dialogue.line: I can't! I thought I made up my mind... I thought I'd do anything for Daein! But then I saw Sothe taken from me, and I saw him fall... I was powerless to do anything! I'd taken so many lives as a general, and yet, when I thought of Sothe dead...

dialogue.speaker: Pelleas
dialogue.line: Even if it hadn't been Sothe in front of you, you would have reacted the same way. That's the kind of person you are.

dialogue.speaker: Pelleas
dialogue.line: Individual lives taken before your eyes weigh more heavily than the many lives taken during the chaos of war. If that life is someone dear, the burden is even worse. It's only human. Isn't that true?

dialogue.speaker: Pelleas
dialogue.line: Micaiah. It's your caring soul that I admire. That's why I want it to be you.

dialogue.speaker: Pelleas
dialogue.line: I want you to kill me.

dialogue.speaker: Micaiah
dialogue.line: No, I can't! I can't do it! Don't make me do this, please!

dialogue.speaker: Pelleas
dialogue.line: "The blood pact breaks when the pact-maker is killed by a third party." That is exactly how it's written. This is the only way to save Daein.

dialogue.speaker: Micaiah
dialogue.line: Please! Please don't ask me to do such a horrible thing.

dialogue.speaker: Pelleas
dialogue.line: This is my duty as king, Micaiah! If you won't do it, I must ask someone else!

dialogue.speaker: Micaiah
dialogue.line: All right... I'll do it... I'll do it for you, and for Daein.

dialogue.speaker: Pelleas
dialogue.line: Thank you, Micaiah.

dialogue.speaker: Pelleas
dialogue.line: General Tauroneo. Please look after the people of Daein.

dialogue.speaker: Tauroneo
dialogue.line: Yes...Your Majesty.

dialogue.speaker: Pelleas
dialogue.line: Sothe. I'm sorry for all that I put you and Micaiah through, including this. Please forgive me.

dialogue.speaker: Sothe
dialogue.line: Don't worry about that now, Pelleas.

dialogue.speaker: Pelleas
dialogue.line: Micaiah. Please give this ring to my mother. Tell her that I loved her dearly.

dialogue.speaker: Micaiah
dialogue.line: ...I will, Your Majesty.

dialogue.speaker: Pelleas
dialogue.line: Good-bye, my friends.

dialogue.speaker: Micaiah
dialogue.line: Your Majesty. Sniff...what have I done?

dialogue.speaker: Almedha
dialogue.line: Pelleas! Is he here?!

dialogue.speaker: Almedha
dialogue.line: NOOOOO!  Pelleas! My dear Pelleas!

dialogue.speaker: Almedha
dialogue.line: Who did this?! Who killed my son?! Was it you?! I know who it was... YOU! You killed my Pelleas!

dialogue.speaker: Sothe
dialogue.line: It was the king's wish. He sacrified himself to make Daein free. He asked Micaiah to end his life.

dialogue.speaker: Tauroneo
dialogue.line: It was an honorable end for a king. Thanks to his noble sacrifice, Daein has been saved.

dialogue.speaker: Almedha
dialogue.line: Fools! Is that what you think?! Daein has not been saved!

dialogue.speaker: Tauroneo
dialogue.line: Wh-what do you mean, my queen?!

dialogue.speaker: Almedha
dialogue.line: Take a good look.

dialogue.speaker: Almedha
dialogue.line: The mark is still on his wrist. My son's death was in vain!

dialogue.speaker: Micaiah
dialogue.line: No! It can't be! Sothe, tell me that it isn't true...

dialogue.speaker: Almedha
dialogue.line: Murderer! Give me back my son! You took my only son! Give him back!

dialogue.speaker: Micaiah
dialogue.line: I...I'm sorry. I can't do this...

dialogue.speaker: Pelleas
dialogue.line: I see... That is all right, Micaiah. I know it's a terrible thing to ask.

dialogue.speaker: Pelleas
dialogue.line: ...General Tauroneo. It is your duty.

dialogue.speaker: Tauroneo
dialogue.line: Your Majesty... Is this necessary?

dialogue.speaker: Pelleas
dialogue.line: This is your king's order, General. You must obey.

dialogue.speaker: Tauroneo
dialogue.line: Such will, at so young an age! ...As you wish, Your Majesty.

dialogue.speaker: Pelleas
dialogue.line: General Tauroneo. Please look after the people of Daein.

dialogue.speaker: Tauroneo
dialogue.line: Queen Almedha...

dialogue.speaker: Almedha

dialogue.speaker: Tauroneo
dialogue.line: No, Queen Almedha. It was I. I killed the king.

dialogue.speaker: Almedha
dialogue.line: Traitor!

dialogue.speaker: Pelleas
dialogue.line: Sothe. I'm sorry for all that I put you and Micaiah through, including this. Please forgive me.

dialogue.speaker: Sothe
dialogue.line: Don't worry about that now, Pelleas.

dialogue.speaker: Pelleas
dialogue.line: Micaiah. Please give this ring to my mother. Tell her that I loved her dearly.

dialogue.speaker: Micaiah
dialogue.line: ...I will, Your Majesty.

dialogue.speaker: Pelleas
dialogue.line: Good-bye, my friends.

dialogue.speaker: Micaiah
dialogue.line: NO! This is wrong! We can't give up, Your Majesty!

dialogue.speaker: Tauroneo
dialogue.line: Eh?

dialogue.speaker: Pelleas
dialogue.line: Micaiah?!

dialogue.speaker: Tauroneo
dialogue.line: Lady Micaiah...

dialogue.speaker: Pelleas
dialogue.line: What did you do?!

dialogue.speaker: Micaiah
dialogue.line: I...I'm all right. I...

dialogue.speaker: Pelleas
dialogue.line: Fetch a healer! Now!

dialogue.speaker: Micaiah
dialogue.line: No, I'm fine, really. I'm just confused... Is the goddess telling me that I'm not worthy to become a martyr for Daein?

dialogue.speaker: Pelleas
dialogue.line: Or maybe she is saying that you're just too important to lose... But this is my fault! It was all because I signed that blood pact! I can only amend my mistake by giving my life!

dialogue.speaker: Micaiah
dialogue.line: You must stop running, Your Majesty.

dialogue.speaker: Pelleas
dialogue.line: Wha--!

dialogue.speaker: Micaiah
dialogue.line: But what if your information is incorrect, Your Majesty? I couldn't live with myself if I'd let you give up your life in vain. There MUST be another way! We'll look for it together. There is... I... I can see...

dialogue.speaker: Sothe
dialogue.line: Micaiah! Hey, Micaiah! Wake up!

dialogue.speaker: Tauroneo
dialogue.line: I will call a healer right away!

dialogue.speaker: Pelleas
dialogue.line: Micaiah... Thank you...

battle.speaker: Daein
battle.line: Maiden of Dawn! The enemy is approaching. Please, you must withdraw inside the castle!

battle.speaker: Micaiah
battle.line: Our defenses have been broken... We did everything we could. It's only a matter of time now.  Daein soldiers, pull back immediately! Take up positions inside the castle! We won't let them take us without a fight!

battle.speaker: Daein
battle.line: The inner gate has been breached! It's only a matter of time before they break through the inner walls.

battle.speaker: Sothe
battle.line: That was fast. We didn't even get a chance to rest.

battle.speaker: Micaiah
battle.line: Isn't there anything else we can do? King Pelleas has worked so hard to find the answer... Was it for nothing? There must be something... A rumor, old folklore... Anything...

battle.speaker: Sothe
battle.line: Hold on. Didn't Lady Almedha seem to know something about the blood pact? Come to think of it, she recognized the mark of the pact on Pelleas's arm right away, like she'd seen one before.

battle.speaker: Micaiah
battle.line: You're right!  Why didn't I realize it sooner? Where is she? Where is Lady Almedha?!

battle.speaker: Daein
battle.line: General! It's no use! We can't hold them off any longer! Enemy troops have broken through and are headed this way! Escape while you can!

battle.speaker: Micaiah
battle.line: No! I must find Lady Almedha! Everything depends on it!

battle.speaker: Ike
battle.line: Break down that gate! If they won't come out, we'll just let ourselves in. All forces, advance!

battle.speaker: Ranulf
battle.line: Ike! We have a problem! A big problem. All this battlefield chaos is starting to really affect the laguz. They're on the verge of losing control. I can't stop them, Ike! If they find Micaiah, they're going to tear her apart. I guarantee it.

battle.speaker: Ike
battle.line: Blast! We need to get them under control. Where's Skrimir?

battle.speaker: Janaff
battle.line: Sheesh! What a relief to finally have the end of this thing in sight. I can't believe what a fight the Daein army put up, especially considering their numbers. Wait a minute... Hey, Ulki. What the heck is that on the horizon?

battle.speaker: Ulki
battle.line: It's flying toward us... The flapping sounds heavier than a wyvern... It sounds huge.

battle.speaker: Tibarn
battle.line: Oh, you've got to be kidding me... All units, get down! NOW!

battle.speaker: Ena
battle.line: All of you are ordered to throw down your weapons and cease fighting! Do this for your own welfare.

battle.speaker: Ike
battle.line: Ena! Elincia! What's going on here?

battle.speaker: Ranulf
battle.line: It's a black dragon of Goldoa...

battle.speaker: Ike
battle.line: Tibarn, what's going on?

battle.speaker: Tibarn
battle.line: Why are you asking me? All I know is that I'm not ready to step up to a black dragon. Did you see that blast?

battle.speaker: Ike
battle.line: Point taken. All units, retreat! Platoon commanders, gather your men!

battle.speaker: Micaiah
battle.line: What just happened? Why did the apostle's army leave? And what was that horrible sound?
Micaiah!

battle.speaker: Micaiah
battle.line: Kurth! Where have you been? I haven't seen you since you left for home. How did you get here? Why would you even come to a horrible place like this?

battle.speaker: Kurthnaga
battle.line: I wanted to save you...and my sister, as well.

battle.speaker: Micaiah
battle.line: Your sister? She's here?

battle.speaker: Kurthnaga
battle.line: Never mind that now. I'm just glad you're safe. Are you hurt?

battle.speaker: Micaiah
battle.line: No, I don't think so. I'm just very confused right now.

battle.speaker: Daein
battle.line: The sub-humans are here! Protect the maiden with your lives!

battle.speaker: Micaiah
battle.line: Stop! Stand down, all of you!

battle.speaker: Micaiah
battle.line: Queen Nailah... Rafiel... I... Th-thank you. Thank you...so...much...

battle.speaker: Rafiel
battle.line: It's all right, Micaiah. It'll be all right...

battle.speaker: Ike
battle.line: That black dragon is Prince Kurthnaga? Sheesh, I thought the lions got big...

battle.speaker: Tibarn
battle.line: Ah, it's the son, is it? I thought maybe the dragon king had shrunk a bit in his old age.

battle.speaker: Skrimir
battle.line: You all know the dragon prince of Goldoa?

battle.speaker: Ranulf
battle.line: Yeah. Goldoa hosted a meeting of laguz royalty three years ago. That's when Tibarn and I met him.

battle.speaker: Ike
battle.line: Elincia and I met him around the same time. I'd say he was a nice kid, except that he's older than all of us put together.

battle.speaker: Ena
battle.line: The prince hopes to avoid the complete destruction of Daein and its people. He wishes to stop the fighting. We would like to ask you to implement a cease-fire and hold a peace talk.

battle.speaker: Sanaki
battle.line: We have attempted to hold peace talks with Daein on multiple occasions! They refuse to listen to reason, and instead choose to fight. We have no more time to waste on people who choose war over peace at every turn!

battle.speaker: Ena
battle.line: Your people are waiting for you in Begnion. Is that what presses you?

battle.speaker: Ike
battle.line: It's not just that. All this strife and chaos has affected the medallion. It's shining brighter each day.

battle.speaker: Elincia
battle.line: No! that can't be!

battle.speaker: Ena
battle.line: The blue flame burns once more...

battle.speaker: Ena
battle.line: The light that radiates from the medallion looks like blue fire. It's this flaming aura that earned the medallion its other name: the Fire Emblem.

battle.speaker: Sanaki
battle.line: The Fire Emblem...

battle.speaker: Ena
battle.line: The flames on the Fire Emblem indicate the awakening of the dark god. If the war is allowed to continue, nothing can stop the dark god's awakening. We must halt this fighting.

battle.speaker: Sanaki
battle.line: If there is a way to stop the fighting, we shall do everything in our power to aid in that effort. We have pursued peace since this began.

battle.speaker: Ena
battle.line: Then let us wait until Prince Kurthnaga returns. He is speaking with the leaders of Daein now.

battle.speaker: Ike
battle.line: Elincia, what are you doing here? Did Ena and Kurth ask you to bring them to this battle?

battle.speaker: Elincia
battle.line: No, that wasn't the case. Prince Kurthnaga and I ran into each other on our way here.

battle.speaker: Lucia
battle.line: We are actually in Daein to look for Count Bastian of Fayre.

battle.speaker: Ike
battle.line: Lucia! You're here, too?

battle.speaker: Lucia
battle.line: Of course. I cannot let Her Majesty out of my sight. You know that.

battle.speaker: Elincia
battle.line: Bastian... He'd been so good about sending me reports until recently.

battle.speaker: Ike
battle.line: He was searching for the Black Knight, right?

battle.speaker: Elincia
battle.line: After the Mad King's War, Begnion sent an envoy to investigate war crimes committed during Ashnard's reign. The Black Knight had already left Daein before the empire's observer arrived. Where he went remains a mystery. That was the last piece of information we received from Bastian. Then he sent word saying that something more important had come up with regards to Crimea. He's been missing ever since. I haven't heard a single word from him.

battle.speaker: Ike
battle.line: Bastian likes to keep his secrets. He's probably just laying low somewhere.

battle.speaker: Lucia
battle.line: I'm not so sure. He must've found something important, some new piece of information that he had to pursue.

battle.speaker: Elincia
battle.line: I ordered Geoffrey to watch over Crimea, and came here to begin a search for Bastian.

battle.speaker: Ike
battle.line: It's too dangerous for you and Lucia to travel by yourselves. Why don't you com with us? Everyone would love having you two around.

battle.speaker: Elincia
battle.line: Than you, Ike. We'll gladly accept the offer.

battle-talk.speaker: Sothe
battle-talk.line: Queen Nailah! Are you going to try to hurt Micaiah?

battle-talk.speaker: Nailah
battle-talk.line: No, silly boy. I'm here to talk to her. Since you know me, why don't you take me to her? I would prefer not to kill all your soldiers if I can help it.

battle-talk.speaker: Sothe
battle-talk.line: I'm sorry, but I can't do that. I can't let a laguz near Micaiah. Lots of people from Daein have issues with the laguz.

battle-talk.speaker: Sothe
battle-talk.line: I know that, but our troops wouldn't understand. I'm sorry, Queen Nailah.

battle-talk.speaker: Sothe
battle-talk.line: I'm...I'm ashamed it has to be like this.

battle-talk.speaker: Nailah
battle-talk.line: Try not to worry. Just...survive, all right? Watch after Micaiah, as well.

battle-talk.speaker: Sothe
battle-talk.line: I will. We're fighting for our survival as it is. I don't plan to let anyone go.

battle-talk.speaker: Nailah
battle-talk.line: Let me hear it from you. Why is Daein involved in this war?

battle-talk.speaker: Volug
battle-talk.line: (The Daein king was tricked into cooperating with Begnion.)

battle-talk.speaker: Volug
battle-talk.line: (They haven’t changed at all. They fight for the continued survival of their country.)

battle-talk.speaker: Nailah
battle-talk.line: I see. They are our friends. We cannot let them fall.

recruit-battle.speaker: Mist
recruit-battle.line: Oww! Hey, that hurts! Sorry, Ike. I’m going to pull back.

recruit-battle.speaker: Mist
recruit-battle.line: Jill! Why? Why are you doing this?!

recruit-battle.speaker: Jill
recruit-battle.line: I’m sorry, Mist. There’s no way we can turn back now.

recruit-battle.speaker: Jill
recruit-battle.line: Mist...run. I won’t be expected to kill you if you just turn and run!

character-falls.speaker: Ike
character-falls.line: Titania! Retreat and don’t exert yourself. We wouldn’t be complete if you weren’t here. We need you.

character-falls.speaker: Titania
character-falls.line: Ah, I understand, Ike. ... You’ve... grown to become a legend... Greil... are you watching? Be proud of your son.

character-falls.speaker: Ranulf
character-falls.line: Arg! Like being hit... with a mountain...

character-falls.speaker: Tibarn
character-falls.line: Ranulf! Enough! Get back! I can’t let you die! What would I tell King Caineghis and Skrimir?

character-falls.speaker: Boyd
character-falls.line: Ugh! They hit me good. I hate to say it, but I have to pull back!

character-falls.speaker: Oscar
character-falls.line: The enemy uses good tactics. Sorry, Ike. I’m pulling back for now.

character-falls.speaker: Shinon
character-falls.line: Why do these softheads keep fighting?! There’s no chance they’ll ever win this battle! I’m pulling back for now. I’m not wasting my arrows on these fools!

character-falls.speaker: Gatrie
character-falls.line: Ugh! Hey, you’re pretty good! Better than I expected, honestly. Ike, I’m pulling back.

character-falls.speaker: Rhys
character-falls.line: Ugh! That’s it for me... I’m pulling back now, everyone.

character-falls.speaker: Mia
character-falls.line: They’re strong! I can’t defeat them! But I’ll be stronger tomorrow, and then we’ll see who wins!

narration: Queen Elincia and the dragons of Goldoa persuade both armies to accept a temporary truce. The blue light that burns within the medallion grows more fierce with each passing day. To prevent the awakening of the evil trapped within, the fighting must be stopped.
However, the apostle and her army refuse to abandon Sephiran's forces in Begnion. Though they hoped that Daein would cease fighting, they knew battle was inevitable. The bloodshed begins anew.

conversation.speaker: Leonardo
conversation.line: Say, Edward. We’ve been fighting really hard for quite a while now, haven’t we?

conversation.speaker: Edward
conversation.line: Yeah, I guess so. The war of emancipation, the war against the Laguz Alliance, and now against the apostle’s army. One after another, just like that.

conversation.speaker: Leonardo
conversation.line: The world can’t always be like this. These wars seem so pointless. All I want is to be able to live in Daein, peacefully and in freedom.

conversation.speaker: Edward
conversation.line: Yeah. The military is a pretty strange place. Hey, I have an idea! Once this battle is over, I’ll quit the army and go home.

conversation.speaker: Leonardo
conversation.line: What about Micaiah and the others? Are you going to abandon them?

conversation.speaker: Edward
conversation.line: What? No way! I’ll just have to talk them into leaving with me! And if that catches on, all the soldiers will leave, and then there can’t be a war. And then Daein will have peace again!

conversation.speaker: Leonardo
conversation.line: You know, I don’t think it’s that simple. But your plan sounds good to me, Edward.

conversation.speaker: Edward
conversation.line: See? You know it’s smart! First, you and I will leave. Together, we can tackle any obstacle!

conversation.speaker: Leonardo
conversation.line: We’ll have to survive the next battle, first. This should help. Here. Look what I got you.

conversation.speaker: Edward
conversation.line: Oh! This sword is amazing! Where did you get this!?

conversation.speaker: Leonardo
conversation.line: I’ve been saving up. Micaiah chipped in, too.

conversation.speaker: Edward
conversation.line: You got this for me?

conversation.speaker: Leonardo
conversation.line: Yeah. Since you’re always fighting so recklessly, I thought this sword would be a good match for you.

conversation.speaker: Edward
conversation.line: Thanks, Leonardo! You’re the best friend I could have!

conversation.speaker: Leonardo
conversation.line: I know. We’re each other’s best friend and family.

conversation.speaker: Aran
conversation.line: Hey, Laura! You dropped a staff over there.

conversation.speaker: Laura
conversation.line: Oh! Ah. Thank you, Aran.

conversation.speaker: Aran
conversation.line: You’ve been carrying a lot of things lately.

conversation.speaker: Laura
conversation.line: Yes, I suppose so. Many people are injured. I wanted to help heal as many of them as I can.

conversation.speaker: Aran
conversation.line: That’s admirable. Is there anything I can do to help?

conversation.speaker: Laura
conversation.line: Yes, of course!

conversation.speaker: Aran
conversation.line: First, hand me all of your things. I’ll carry them for you.

conversation.speaker: Laura
conversation.line: That would be great. Here you go. Say...

conversation.speaker: Aran
conversation.line: Hmm?

conversation.speaker: Laura
conversation.line: That staff you picked up earlier... It doesn’t belong to me.

conversation.speaker: Aran
conversation.line: Really? It was right at your feet, so I’d assumed that it was yours.

conversation.speaker: Laura
conversation.line: I’ve never seen a staff like this. I wonder what effect it has?

conversation.speaker: Aran
conversation.line: Hey, be careful. It might be dangerous or something. Let’s throw it away.

conversation.speaker: Laura
conversation.line: Well, maybe if I shake it like this... And then... Whoa!

conversation.speaker: Aran
conversation.line: Wuh!

conversation.speaker: Laura
conversation.line: What did you say, Aran?

conversation.speaker: Aran
conversation.line: Zzz... Zzz...

conversation.speaker: Laura
conversation.line: Oh, Aran. You’re such a clown. How do you fall asleep on your feet? I guess you must be really tired. Why don’t I just leave you be? Let me just take my things back.

conversation.speaker: Aran
conversation.line: Zzz... Zzz... Zzz...
